text: Mary Katherine Vernon (born 1953) is an American computer scientist who works as a professor of computer science and industrial engineering at the University of Wisconsin–Madison. Her research concerns high-performance computer architecture and streaming media.Faculty profile, Univ. of Wisconsin, retrieved 2015-06-30. Vernon graduated from the University of California, Los Angeles in 1975 with a B.S. in chemistry,Researcher: Mary Vernon, Wisconsin Discovery Portal, retrieved 2015-06-30. and earned her Ph.D. in computer science from UCLA in 1983 under the supervision of Gerald Estrin. She was named a Fellow of the Association for Computing Machinery in 1996 "for fundamental contributions to performance analysis of parallel computer architectures and for leadership in the computing research community."ACM Fellows award citation, retrieved 2015-06-30. ==Selected publications== *. *. *. *. ==References== Category:1953 births Category:Living people Category:American computer scientists Category:American women computer scientists Category:American industrial engineers Category:University of California, Los Angeles alumni Category:University of Wisconsin–Madison faculty
title: Mary K. Vernon
